Text.Value: The goblins... do they fight well?
I had my doubts, but you came through. Thank you.
Never mind that - focus on the party we're going to have when all this is over.
Well enough. But you have what they don't - something to fight for.
Some of us have more of that than others. I'll just be glad to live out the day.
The goblins... look so small. Hard to believe I was ever afraid of them.
They don't have skill, but numbers and luck can matter more.
Hah! I wish I had your confidence. But... thank you.
Why don't you find your own stretch of wall to die on?
I'm just here for the show. Make it a good one, won't you?
Heh, that obvious? But you're right. Can't swing a sword if I'm shaking like a leaf.
Take care. I'll feel better on the roads knowing you're out there somewhere.
Wrong question. You don't need to fight better than them - you just need to fight harder.
Leave me alone. I don't want company.
Better than a mob of undisciplined tieflings.
You're right. Blood or not, the people here are family. And I won't let goblins take that away - not again.
Leave.
They're a mob. Take heart - you fight with clan beside you.
They're not well-trained, just vicious.
Go charm someone else.
Like drunk children. Worse than drunk children - you'll be fine.
All that talk of fighting... you spared us that. Thank you.
I'd have put good coin on you running off into the sunset, but you did it. You stopped the goblins. Thank you.
After that... well, I pity whatever tries us on the road to Baldur's Gate.
Gods, I almost wish they were here. I just want this done.
You... mean that to be comforting, I'm sure.
Wonderful. I hope you brought both in equal measure.
You again. Just when I thought today couldn't get any worse.
It doesn't matter. The true opponent is fear - and you've faced it before. Everyone has.
Heh. Damn straight - to the Nine Hells with them. We won't go down without a fight.

Synopsis: Guard nervously awaiting the start of a battle. Player may have met previously, when her legs were immobilised by a potion.
